boardgame.name: Octagon
boardgame.description:
Octagon is ideally played with a 40-card deck containing six suits; the cards are numbered 1-12 but the suits have different numbers of cards, e.g. the blue suit consists of 1, 6, 7, and 12.

Most of the cards are shuffled and dealt into eight face-down piles of four cards each, in the form of an octagon. The blue cards and matching black cards are placed face-up on top of these as the dealer chooses.

A turn consists of picking up a stack of cards, revealing them, and then placing them on successive stacks in clockwise order. If a stack has just one or two cards in it the top card can be captured by placing a card of the same rank on it. There are a few additional rules, e.g. when capturing counterclockwise moves may be made.

At the end of the round captured cards are scored; different suits score differently, e.g. the blue cards are 10 points each, black cards (the longest suit) score only for the player with the most, red cards score for sequences, etc.

Four players play in partnerships; while the rules technically allow for play by four or five individuals, only three play at a time.

Rules are provided to allow play with a standard deck.

boardgame.name: Amazon Peril
boardgame.description:
During the heydey of Amazonian exploration of the 1930s, you are a character drawn to the Amazonian jungle with your own personal agenda to be there (Anthropologist, Archeologist, Big Game Hunter, Botanist, Bush Pilot, Cartographer, Journalist or Treasure Seeker), with each character offering its own unique traits and skills.

You find yourself on a flight to a jumping off point in the jungle, along with other characters with their own reasons pulling them to this part of the world. Unfortunately, soon after take-off, the plane engine gives out and the pilot is forced to make an emergency landing in the middle of the jungle. Now, stranded in the jungle how will you – and your companions who you don’t know – survive and escape? Can you trust them? Will you work together or splinter off on your own? The choice is yours.

In Amazon Peril, you and your companions will begin the game, lost somewhere in the jungle and you will have to use your skills to explore, survive and escape the jungle by finding the airstrip you left from. Each round is a day; you’ll make plans in the morning, in the afternoon you’ll execute them and in the evening you’ll assess your thirst, hunger and health and prepare for the next day.

Each morning, choose from these core actions: camping for the day (where you try to rest up and heal), scouting (where you’ll cautiously explore the jungle around you) and exploring (where you’ll move through the jungle, placing and revealing new tiles that can lead to many dangerous and exciting outcomes; maybe you’ll stumble across an indigenous tribe, find ancient ruins or encounter dangerous wildlife).

You may choose to go it alone for riskier encounters but more rewards; or journey in groups to lessen the risk but split the rewards. But be careful; desperate circumstances can bring out the worst in people. You might be tempted to steal supplies from your companions at night or they might steal from you!

As you journey through the jungle, you can gain or lose renown points for the actions you take and the discoveries you make. It isn’t just about survival; those who survive will have tales to tell and deeds to boast of - and whomever has the most renown points when the airstrip is finally revealed will win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Maverick
boardgame.description:
The local townsfolk have hired you, a monster slayer, to clear a dungeon full of monsters that have been attacking the citizens. Negotiate payment and start hunting…

Maverick is a card game for one or two players with solo, cooperative, and versus modes. You must flip all the monster cards in the row face down before you run out of action cards; you flip a monster card face down by playing action cards that move your monster slayer and/or animal companion cards into position to successfully do all the actions listed on the monster card. To maximize your score, you’ll have to assess the dungeon and make a wager before the game starts, and then decide the best use of each action card throughout the game to collect trophies and end the game with as many remaining action cards as possible.

boardgame.name: Office Space: The Game
boardgame.description:
This is a secret missions game to play at work. It was inspired by one of our favorite movies, Office Space. If you love the movie then you’ll enjoy all the in-jokes in the game. But it’s still a great game even if you’ve never seen it.

It works like this: draw six secret missions each and the first player to complete three missions wins. The missions involve tricking your colleagues into doing things without them realizing, including stealing Milton’s famous red stapler.

Work might suck sometimes, but this game will make it suck a little less.

boardgame.name: Us Weekly: The Game
boardgame.description:
This is a team party game for anyone who has read about a celeb or two. Get ready to roll out the red carpet because two legendary teams (that’s you guys) will be going head-to-head across two very different rounds.

In Round 1 a player from each team races to name as many celebs as they can, based on a given category, against the clock. The winner from this round takes an advantage into Round 2: Triple Charades Jeopardy.

In this final round, players must get their team to guess the celebs in three different ways: by acting, using one word and describing. First team to collect a celeb from all 8 categories wins! The game plays just like the Blockbuster and MTV game.

boardgame.name: Herd Mentality
Herdentier
Mente Vacuna
Meuhte
Troupeau
boardgame.description:
This is a party game for families, friends and cow rustlers. The aim of the game is simple: think like the herd and write down the same answers as your friends.

If your answer is part of the majority, you all win cows. Yeehaw! If everyone else writes an answer that is matched by at least one other person, but yours is the odd one out, then you land the angry Pink Cow, and your herd of cows is worthless until you can offload it onto someone else.

The first player to collect eight cows wins.

boardgame.description:

One player might have to draw Piglet mowing the lawn, another drawing Aladdin jumping out of a cake. Everyone passes their magnificent doodles to the next player who must guess what they can see. Points for the best drawings and silliest guesses.

boardgame.name: Sumire
boardgame.description: Sumire is an upcoming indie adventure set in a mystical Japanese mountain village. Take the girl Sumire on a quest-filled journey through a strange world of odd characters, talking creatures, and magical settings -- but it will only last a day.

boardgame.description: Craftopia is the brand new multiplayer survival action game made in Japan. We combined many features we find enjoyable, such as hunting, farming, hack-and-slash, building, automation to develop this game.

boardgame.name: Teen Detective
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In Teen Detective, you don’t just solve teen-based mysteries, it’s also down to you to decide what to do about the culprits and how best to put things right. In some cases you can hand them over to the police, in others you may have to get a lot more creative. Your own teen may not be entirely innocent: your teen’s motivation may clash with your fellows and your family may be harbouring a darker secret than you know.

boardgame.name: Ikenfell
boardgame.description:
Turn-based magical RPG!
A turn based-tactical RPG about a group of troublesome magic students. Use timing mechanics to power your spells and block attacks, explore the twisted halls of a vast magic school, fight challenging monsters and bosses, find tons of hidden treasure, and uncover dark secrets never meant to be found.

Ikenfell is a heartwarming and twist-filled story about friendship, trust, love and loss.

UNIQUE FEATURES
48 unique spells to blast your enemies with
80+ enemies to battle
20 challenging bosses
100+ items to discover
Explore the whole school
Beautiful soundtrack from the composers behind Steven Universe
Cats. Everywhere.

Developed by Chevy Ray Johnston.
https://twitter.com/chevyray

boardgame.name: P for Pizza
P wie Pizza
boardgame.description:
This is a quick-thinking category game.

The aim of the game is to build your giant slice of pizza by winning small triangles of pizza. To win a triangle you must be the first player to shout out a word that links the category and the letter on the cards. So if the letter is B and the category is TV Shows, you could shout “Baywatch!”. If you’re first to shout a correct answer, you win the card. Now flip a new card and go again. Each round there are three letters and three categories on the table, so you can link any letter to any category. You just need to be super quick!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sugar Heist
boardgame.description:
Sugar Heist is an action-packed heist game where players collect, trade, and steal candy cards. Dominate your opponents and strategically steal their sweets as you battle it out for the biggest stash of candy.

Sometimes though, other players may not want to give you their confectionary treasures and you might have to play a Battle Card. Execute your strategies and plan your next move. Beg, barter, steal, and battle your way to supremacy in this wacky set collecting game.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Smashers: Chibi Fantasy Role-Playing Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

[The] characters will attempt to explore a dungeon looking for treasure and to make a name for themselves throughout the entire kingdom.
...
Dungeon Smashers is a retro clone role-playing based on the advanced version of the best and greatest fantasy roleplaying game in the world. It is fully compatible with this game.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Smashers: Paper Miniatures
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Dungeon Smashers: Paper Miniatures are print-and-play, full-color pages presenting paper miniatures.

boardgame.name: Just Another Day at the Office
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Just Another Day at the Office is an action game with a retro style graphical presentation. Taking place in an office, the game's central character is an office worker that is fed up with the typical 9-5 grind, and the goal is to escape the office while creating as much destruction as possible. The game features many different tools for wreaking havoc in the workplace. The player must watch out for the police and bankers looking to track them down. The game also features a mode that allows the player to take a break from the action and read various in-game books and documents as well as speak to various NPCs.

boardgame.name: Star and Light 1.0
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Star and Light 1.0 is an indie puzzle game that puts players in the role of Adhara. The game presents several puzzles as the player explores an abandoned temple. The overarching story is presented with a number of cutscenes and dialogues between characters. It is presented in a 2D graphical style and offers additional bonus content including collectibles, achievements, new game+, and various costumes for the player character.

boardgame.name: Guppy
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Guppy is described as a 2D watercolor fish simulation. The game's art style is a watercolor painting come to life, and the player controls a fish attempting to find food while avoiding getting caught or eaten. The game offers an atmospheric soundtrack and features a relaxation mode.

boardgame.name: Shipwreck
boardgame.description:
User Summary

An action adventure game that strands the player on an island, Shipwreck is an action-adventure game heavily inspired by top-down, 2D adventure games. The player must explore the island and collect resources, all the while fighting off various creatures and clearing dungeons in an attempt to earn safe passage off the island.

boardgame.name: Time Stone
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Time Stone is a pixel art indie game that puts the player in the role of Elle, a Wizard's apprentice. After arriving at her professor's house for a lesson, she finds that an evil Warlock has put him in grave danger, and she must uncover a secret in order to save him. The game is a point-and-click adventure directly inspired by games such as Day of the Tentacle and Simon the Sorcerer.

boardgame.name: devtheism
boardgame.description:
User Summary

devtheism is a indie RPG/text adventure that tells the story of the developer of the game dealing with internet stereotypes. The story promotes respect and tolerance online and attempts to make the player question their own behavior. The game can be completed in roughly 15-20 minutes.

boardgame.name: Laza Knitez
boardgame.description:
User Summary

LAZA KNITEZ is a jousting game with a retro art style. The player has a laser-lance and fights other jousters in the "technofuture." The game offers a variety of power ups that give players an advantage over their opponents. The game supports local multiplayer for up to 4 players.

boardgame.name: QLRZ
boardgame.description:
User Summary

QLRZ is an arcade puzzle game in the vein of top-down, vertical scrolling shooters. Various colored meteors fall down the screen, and the player must destroy them by shooting them. At the end of each level, a boss appears that the player must defeat. The game has a worldwide leaderboard system where players can compare scores.

boardgame.name: Little Cells
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Little Cells is a simple puzzle game that takes place under a microscope. Players must identify cells of the same color and launch one into the other, making them disappear. There's also a mechanic where players must create white cells in order to prevent the colored cells from spreading and contaminating the whole system. The longer the player manages to eliminate cells and avoid contamination, the higher their score.

boardgame.name: Wordsmithery
boardgame.description:
Wordsmithery is dead easy. Guess the meaning of word. All 700 of our words are exactly the kind of words that you pretend to understand…when you don’t. Words like egregious, phalanx and salubrious. Don’t worry. You get three possible – and fun – definitions to choose from. First to ten points wins. Over to you.

Game for 2 players or teams. On each turn a player draws a word, reads it to their opponent, and the opponent attempts to guess the meaning from three options. Each correct guess is two points, first one to ten wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Of Tooth and Claw
boardgame.description:
From the publisher page:
A beautiful RPG-sized hardcover collecting issues 7-12 of the Pathfinder comic series.
An adaptation of the adventure from the best-selling Pathfinder RPG Beginner Box, making it a perfect jumping on point for game fans and new readers alike.
An extensive cover gallery of alternate cover illustrations.
More than 30 pages of encounters and world detail for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.
A brand new poster map.

boardgame.name: Entkommen!: Der gefangene Geheimagent
boardgame.description:
The world hour of Sarajevo. Can you change the course of the world?

A secret organization that plans to murder the heir to the throne.

A secret agent trapped in a dungeon.

Secret codes, closed doors, puzzles for experts.

You only have 60 minutes to prevent an assassination attempt. Can you "ESCAPE" in time?

The escape game on the go - for one or more players.

Volume 2 of the ESCAPE series.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: 100 Strange Beliefs to Hold
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Characters may encounter strange religions and cults during their adventures, or perhaps just individuals who hold beliefs that may be considered to be peculiar or out of the ordinary. This supplement has 100 different odd beliefs that these groups and individuals might hold. Some are pretty harmless, except perhaps to the holder, but others could result in believers causing harm to others for a variety of reasons, some supposedly good, others not.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Our bodies are imperfect containers and we must modify and alter them to make them truly worthy of hosting the divine spark.

Our clothing must be made from raw hides and wool, natural and untainted by artificial alterations.

Pain redeems those inflicting it and those receiving it, so redeem others and yourself by inflicting as much pain as possible.

Pink is a demonic colour and wearers of it are demon worshippers.

Possessions are evil and we must give them away to those who are already corrupted.

One page is the front cover and one the front matter.

boardgame.name: A Baker's Dozen of Drugs
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

This is a collection of new drugs for Shadow of the Demon Lord. Many of them have advantages for the user if taken, which is why they are taken, but they also have disadvantages, if the user becomes addicted to the drug in question and, for some of the drugs, for overusing them. In one case, the drug has only minor truly beneficial effects for the user; instead, it is used to control people. Many of these drugs will be difficult to get hold of, for most would be considered illegal at best and evidence of demonic influence at worst. They are all classed as forbidden items when it comes to purchasing them. All the prices are for one dose of the drug.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

The drugs are as follows:

Acrobat's Delight
Bliss
Death's Grace
Essence of Summer
Hell Taint
Jotun's Blood
Kiss of Darkness
Lucidity
Mystic Insight
Night Visions
Silver Tongue
Strength of Mind
Void Dust

One page is the front cover and most of one page is blank.

boardgame.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Black Temple Raid Deck
boardgame.description: A raid expansion for WoW TCG setting heroes against a boss player in a remake of the Black Temple raid from The Burning Crusade.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game

boardgame.name: City of Solstice: Evil Streets - Adventure #1 Home Invasion
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the first adventure for City of Solstice: Evil Streets!

You are not adventurers.

They’re dead.

Just like His Royal Majesty, Prince Roth, Earl of the City of Solstice and his wife, the Princess Sirena.

Their killers were the Star Society, five rival criminal organizations who joined together as one. They are: the Church of Mother Moon, led by the Shadow Shroud, a mysterious prophetess, the Nizari, most ruthless mercenary company in the known world, the shadow archers of the Sagittarius Sect, the mysterious elven executioners of the Order of Antares, and the martial arts masters known as the Five Forms.

The city is now theirs in all but name. The Royal Chancellor, Lord Toren, Her Majesty’s Lord Protector, is officially in charge of the city. But everyone knows he’s a tired old man who looks the other way while terror rules the streets.

You patrol the streets of the Gentry Quarter, a once-prosperous neighborhood, now a ramshackle mess of tenements, crime, and homelessness. Last night a tenement housing the working poor was the site of a massacre. Was this some dark sacrifice by the Star Society, or the work of a deranged lunatic acting on deadly desires no sane man can comprehend? From your base on the Wary Cog you have been dispatched to investigate this brutal mass murder and bring the perpetrators to justice.

You are members of the Vigilant, a thoroughly corrupted effigy of a once proud guild, charged with keeping order in a chaotic city of 100,000 souls. You are not adventurers. But you have a duty.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Hunt'em Legends
boardgame.description:
As a player, you will control a group of Hunters that will fight against the monsters deployed on the table, all of them based on historical, mythological and literary characters. Could you imagine commanding Alexander the Great, Jeanne d'Arc or Sir Lancelot, and fighting fearsome rivals as the Boogie Monster, Dracula or the Demogorgon.

The objective is simple: get enough reputation to win the round. ¡But be aware! ¡Your opponent also has their own party of Hunters and will try to overcome you in a race to victory.

boardgame.name: Lucky Flip
boardgame.description:
Lucky Flip is the fun-for-all roulette style party game that pits family and friends against each other in a lively challenge of strategy, memory, & luck. There are 53 total cards in the deck- forty cards numbered 1-40, 10 Lucky Pot Cards, and 3 Lucky Flip cards. The objective of this game is to win more points than your opponents by correctly guessing what each card will reveal once flipped over. To increase the chances of winning even more points, players must rely on their memory to avoid guessing cards that were already flipped and removed from the deck. Playing Lucky Flip is as easy as 1, 2, 3!

~Each player receives 7 tokens to start the game and attempts to guess what the top card will reveal once flipped over by placing all their tokens on the game board.

~Top Card is flipped over to see who won points:
1 point- Guess the correct color
2 points- Guess the correct group of numbers
3 points- For every token on a winning number
10 or 30 points- Guess the Lucky Pot card
100 points- Guess the Lucky Flip card
~Players on winning number roll the dice to double their total points won for that round

This fast-paced party game is easy to learn and play, making it perfect for players at all skill levels and those ages 12 and up. The rules are short and simple; making it easy to convince friends and family to gather around. With 2 – 6 players, Lucky Flip promise to be an exciting game where everyone leaves as happy as the winner.

The objective of the game is to earn points by correctly guessing what the top card on the deck will reveal by placing your tokens on the Lucky Flip game board.

—description from the designer

DreadOut 2

Help the survivors live through fights and manage their rations to avoid permanent death, and they just might be able to reach the Sanctuary.

boardgame.name: Floppy Knights

Meet the Floppy Knights: tangible projections summoned from floppy disks. They’ll help Phoebe and Carlton earn cash and perhaps even save the world in the process.

boardgame.name: Spaceship Commander
boardgame.description: Fight in space or on the planet, or just travel in universe. Visit cities and buildings, mining resources, trade or speak with the population of the planets. Explore something new. Buy yourself a new ship, upgrade him and hire a whole army of the crew!

boardgame.name: VR Mummy Girl
VR包帯少女
boardgame.description: A mummy girl who has been asleep deep inside a pyramid for more than 1000 years wakes up. She doesn’t know what era is it is, who she is, or the reason she's there. She keeps walking, trying to find the exit.

boardgame.name: Pirates Outlaws
boardgame.description: Pirates Outlaws is an easy-to-play roguelike card game. Build your deck and combos to become a reputed pirate.

boardgame.name: Mine Dungeon 2 -Rurumu's Trip-
boardgame.description: A Minesweeper game with a cute character, the control like a action game, and there have barrier objects and enemies.

boardgame.name: Ten People Ten Colors

PEOPLE suddenly wondered into a colorful world...
Save PEOPLE as they run for their lives!

New sensation puzzle action!

As you change the stage's background color, the same color of blocks and PEOPLE appear and disappear...
Remove the blocks carefully and lead PEOPLE to the goal!

ぶんまわしヒーロー / Full Swing Hero

boardgame.name: HAAK
boardgame.description:
Trudge through the wasteland of the apocalypse and seek the light of hope.

HAAK is a retro, apocalyptic-themeed Metroidvania Game with a retro art style.

Fluid movement and unique weapon settings provide the foundation for a fast and pleasant experience.

boardgame.name: Character Options: Talents III
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Character Options: Talents III is the 3rd book from Platinum best selling Character Options: Talents series!

It has over 375 talents that will cover archetypes, classes, and races. It now includes the new boon talents, which requires specific alignments, and hundreds more to support and improve multiclassing options!

It also overs the following new races: Aasimar, Bugbear, Centaur, Firbolg, Goblin, Goliath, Hobgoblin, Loxodon, Kalashtar, Kenku, Lizardfolk, Orc, Simic Hybrid, Tabaxi, Tortle, Triton, Vedalken, Verdan, and Yuan-ti.

boardgame.name: INFINOS EXA
boardgame.description: Action

boardgame.name: The Egg of Hawk
boardgame.description:
From the front of the book (English)
An Advanced Fighting Fantasy adventure for 3-5 novice adventurers in the Blackmoor Living World

From the front of the book (Italian)
Una avventura Advanced Fighting Fantasy per 3-5 avventurieri novizi a Blackmoor, il Mondo Vivente


From the back of the book (English)
In the village where you were born and breed they say that a few years ago, one of the local youths, when time came to become an adventurer, went to the Peaks of Booh and found a hawk's egg. Knowing that the royal coat of arms of the Aandahar is in fact a hawk, he gave the egg to the king to make the small hawk grow and train for hunting. The King was very pleased with this gift and rewarded the novice adventurer both with gold and, above all, with his esteem. Following in his footsteps could be the ideal start of your adventuring career!

From the back of the book (Italian)
Nel tuo villaggio di origine si dice che, pochi anni fa, uno dei giovani del posto, quando venne il suo tempo de diventare un avventuriero, andò sulle Cime di Booh e trovò un uovo de falco. Sapendo che lo stemma reale degli Aandahar rappresenta proprio un falco, donò l'uovo al Re perché facesse nascere il falchetto e lo addestrasse per la caccia. Il Re fu molto lieto di tale dono e ricompensò l'avventuriero novizio sia con oro che, soprattutto, con la sua stima. Seguire le sue orme potrebbe essere l'inizio ideale della tua carriera da avventuriero!

boardgame.name: Mythic Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

First introduced in Mythic Odyssey's of Theros, a Mythic Encounter is an optional rule you can apply to a creature which increases the difficulty. This takes the form of a Mythic Trait, which triggers most often on reducing the creature to 0 hit points. After which, it transforms, musters its strength, or exposes a new objective—extending the fight and unlocking new powers and abilities for the creature.

In Mythic Encounters, we bring that mechanic to all your old favorite creatures!

36 monsters of CR 21+, updated to Mythic Proportions. Covering all CR 21+ creatures from the following official hardcovers (plus more):
- Monster Manual
- Volo’s Guide to Monsters
- Mordenkainen’s Tome of Foes
- Mordenkainen’s Fiend Folio Volume 1: Monsters Malevolent and Benign.

16 brand new mythic spells & 67 mythic items, rewards for slaying the mythic beasts!

A brand-new Background: Mythic Ascendant, not all heroes are forged, some are born— foretold to accomplish great deeds!

An epic Boon: Boon of the Mythic Hero, learn your foes tactics and embody their fighting spirit! Gain new ways of interacting with Mythic Spells and Items, too!

What is a Mythic Encounter? Don’t worry! We include a short guide on how to create your own!
Fantastic Forgotten Realms lore! Not playing Forgotten Realms? Not an issue! Throw the lore out, we don’t mind!

Gorgeous art pieces, custom and licensed, by talented artists like Dante Ezio Cifaldi, Marcel Budde, Lluis Abadias, Leonardo Lambrecht, Nikki Dawes, and GeunBrush.

boardgame.name: Shop of Tentacles
boardgame.description: Anime

boardgame.name: Nosferatu Lilinor
boardgame.description: It is cute but extremely hard!!! The immortal girl keeps to be reborn any number of times even if she gets beaten. It is an action game that includes puzzle-like elements by learning the movement and timing of the enemies.

boardgame.name: Socially Unacceptable
boardgame.description:
Perfect for game nights, parties, holidays, or any day! If you like other adult type of cards games, you are going to love Socially Unacceptable!
Create your own outrageously funny combination of gestures and impressions to answer life's (not so) important silly questions. Why just read an answer card or pick a picture to fill in the question blank? Take it to the next level!
Act out your answer or do an impression to embarrass your family and friends even more! Adults Only: This game contains adult content and was created for ages 17+. There are some things you can't unseen or unhear! This game has a lot of both!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rolling Gunner
boardgame.description:
With its reliance on BAC, humanity had forgotten how to operate even basic transportation, let alone weapons.
After the attacks from BAC and the subsequent social chaos,
the human population was reduced by half.

However, there was a group within Lerman Matsunaga that foresaw the dangers
of a dependence on Buster Engines and the BAC that controlled them.
This group led the third stage of energy development, an anti-BAC weapon
developed in secret that would render Busterium inert, called the Rolling Gun.

boardgame.name: Code Name: Bakery Girl
Reverse Collapse: Code Name Bakery
boardgame.description: The story happens in the future, the world is plagued by war and resource crisis because of the Collapse Fluid pollution. During the world's post-war reconstruction process, two factions began their confrontation.

boardgame.name: Machina of the Planet Tree -Unity Unions-
boardgame.description: This is a story that takes place after the events of Machina of the Planet Tree -Planet Ruler-. Corona Megistus is a young girl who comes from a family of gemstone magicians. While out training, a chance encounter causes her to come into contact with the core of the Machina, Arcturus. His appearance is a sign that the peace the world has enjoyed is in danger as the seal on a great evil begins to weaken. With the world in danger, the novice gemstone magician departs on a journey with Arcturus to hone her powers and prevent the return of Nova.

boardgame.name: Fredigar's Hope
boardgame.description:
From the front of the book (English)
An Advanced Fighting Fantasy adventure for 3-5 novice adventurers in the Blackmoor Living World

From the front of the book (Italian)
Una avventura Advanced Fighting Fantasy per 3-5 avventurieri novizi a Blackmoor, il Mondo Vivente


From the back of the book (English)
As many young adventurers in Blackmoor, the first adventure that you want to face is going to the Comeback Inn, a very famous place where all Blackmoorian adventurers worth mentioning have been and where the very story of the kingdom has been moulded.

The foundation of the Inn is another story shrouded in myth and perhaps you will be able to learn a bit of it... but you will have to be very careful not to get in a brawl with other patrons, as among them there may be legendary warriors and mages with a legendary short temper! Be careful!

From the back of the book (Italian)
Come molti giovani avventurieri di Blackmoor, la prima avventura per te è andare alla Comeback Inn, un posto molto famoso dove sono passati tutti gli avventurieri di Blackmoor deni di nota e dove è stata plasmata la storia del Regno.

La fondazione della locanda è un'altra storia avvolta nel mito e forse riuscirai ad apprenderne un po'... ma dovrai stare molto attento a non entrare in una rissa con altri avventori, poiché tra di loro ci potrebbero essere guerrieri e maghi leggendari e con un temperamento irascibile! Stai attento!

boardgame.name: Perds pas le Nord!
boardgame.description:
A trivia game with questions about the North of France.

Edited by the Chamber of commerce of Nord-Pas de Calais region with the sponsorship of 10 companies.

boardgame.name: Garrison: Archangel
boardgame.description: Garrison: Archangel is a fast-paced, customizable, mecha fighting game designed for epic anime style one-on-one and multiplayer team battles. Design, build and pilot your Archangels today!

boardgame.name: The New Marvel-Phile (Issue 38)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

And if you thought dealing with today's technology was tough, try being any of these folks! The first of this month's issues features a bunch of characters modified with Deathlok technology, written by Frank Stark with assistance by Simon Barns. We hope you enjoy!

boardgame.name: Me and (My) Cat's Castle X
boardgame.description: This is a jump action game that leads "me" which changes state by including the onigiri in the mouth to the power spot "Neko image" which is ahead of each stage which is a little challenging.

boardgame.name: Plusris
boardgame.description:
Play with just one finger.
One stroke brain training addition puzzle game to improve your brain.
A simple yet profound free brain training puzzle game using numbers.

The rules are simple.
Trace the numbers with your fingers, add them, make them 10 and erase them.
Clear the stage by erasing all of them.

boardgame.name: MAMIYA
MAMIYA - A Shared Illusion of the World's End
World Downfall Our Imaginary "Mamiya"
boardgame.description:
Tokyo, during the year in which the world was prophesied to end.

As we clung to reality, too spineless to throw our lives away together, we met Mamiya.

At a friend’s funeral, the entire crowd was weeping and mourning, while we thought to ourselves that the death of a single person had no meaningful impact on the world at large.
We slept, woke up, and went through the same daily grind as ever. At least, that’s how it was supposed to be.

Then Mamiya appeared…

Before we even knew it, the mysterious child named Mamiya had wormed their way into our daily lives. They slowly, but surely, became something of an emotional support. They’d brought us down a new path.

A path that would surely lead us to our deaths…

boardgame.name: GO HOME
GOHOME
boardgame.description: This is a third-person horror game set in a residential area in 2000s Japan. It's the complete version of the free horror game GOHOME, which was released in 2019 and caused a boom. The map has been doubled, and six more ghosts, including hidden characters, have been added to the game.

boardgame.name: Audio Party Pack
boardgame.description: A party game designed around sound. Includes 3 mini-games featuring "sound" focused gameplay!This party game is designed with visual impairments in mind as it relies strongly on sound. There are three mini-games, each focusing on a different challenge.

boardgame.name: Remain on Earth
boardgame.description: Post-Apocalyptic

boardgame.name: Monster Girls You-ki Chan
boardgame.description: This is a simple execute and jump action with two buttons, jump and shot. Recover the human world from a corps of monsters with a variety of weapons and techniques while freely grabbing the ceiling and walls!

boardgame.name: Foregone
boardgame.description: Foregone is a fast and fluid 2D action-platformer packed with legendary loot and stunning pixel art. Collect an arsenal of powerful weapons and unravel a compelling story of regret and conspiracy as you slice your way through hordes of enemies to save Calagan.

boardgame.name: Red Ice on the Black Sea
boardgame.description:
From the front of the book (English)
An Advanced Fighting Fantasy adventure for 3-5 low-experienced adventurers in the Blackmoor Living World

From the front of the book (Italian)
Una avventura Advanced Fighting Fantasy per 3-5 avventurieri principianti a Blackmoor, il Mondo Vivente


From the back of the book (English)
It is one of the coldest Winters of your young lives and the Black Sea between Blackmoor and Frisia is frozen solid. Nevertheless, you are in search of adventures. A small, isolated village in front of the newly formed ice pack has been assaulted and nobody else apart from you can help then: will you answer to their plead?

Part one of The Long Vigil adventure arc.

From the back of the book (Italian)
É uno degli inverni piú freddi delle vostre giovani vite e il Mar Nero, tra Blackmoor e la Frisia é completamente gelato. Nonostante questo, siete in cerca di avventure. Un piccolo villaggio isolato di fronte alla banchisa appena formata é stato assalito e nessun altro a parte voi puó aiutarlo: risponderete alla richiesta di aiuto?

Prima parte del ciclo di avventure: La Lunga Veglia.

boardgame.name: Battleground Brawl
boardgame.description:
Battleground Brawl is a tabletop, platform fighting game that pits fighters (players) against each other in an attempt to either deplete the opponents health, or knock them off of the play area, in order to score points.

The play area consists of a board with a grid. This grid is the guide for where platforms and players can be placed. To set up the game, players agree on the placement of the platform pieces and then choose where to place their fighters. For round 1, the player with the lowest health starts, and each subsequent round the "first player" moves clockwise. Each round, players must first take it in turns, going clockwise from the "first player", to move their fighters according to their movement field. If a player moves adjacent to another player, then that player is not allowed to move in this turn, as they are deemed to be engaged in battle.

Once all players that can move, have moved, then the combat phase begins. Each player plays a card face-down from their hand and chooses a target opponent. A hand consists of 5 cards drawn from that players deck. A deck consists of a number of cards available to each fighter.

Once every player has played a card face down and declared a target, flip the cards and resolve them in the same order as movement in that round. Some cards may be played out of order, as a reaction to other cards, for example: If Player 1 targets Player 4 with an attack card, but Player 4 played a dodge card, then Player 4 resolves this action before Players 2 and 3. If Player 2 (and/or 3) also targeted Player 4, they target that players previous location and therefore Player 4 dodges all attacks simultaneously, they do not target the new location.

Once all actions have been resolved and health deducted/added where appropriate, the "first player" switches clockwise and the next round begins. Discard previously played cards and draw your hand back up to 5 cards. Declare your movement (if applicable), then your targets, then play your next card, and repeat.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Lair of the Frogs
boardgame.description:
From the front of the book (English)
An Advanced Fighting Fantasy adventure for 3-5 low-experienced adventurers in the Blackmoor Living World

From the front of the book (Italian)
Una avventura Advanced Fighting Fantasy per 3-5 avventurieri principianti a Blackmoor, il Mondo Vivente


From the back of the book (English)
There is only one part of the Kingdom of Blackmoor that never freezes solid in Winter: the Great dismal Swamp, known for having so many hot springs that they make its climate milder. These springs let out sulphurous water, that stinks quite bad, but many adventurers prefer it to freezing. For this reason, you are travelling to South Pim, the second biggest settlement of the Great Dismal Swamp after Lake Gloomy, a place known as a good starting point for adventurers.

Who knows what adventures are waiting for you in the Great Dismal Swamp?

From the back of the book (Italian)
C'è solo una parte del Regno di Blackmoor che non gela mai in inverno: la Grande Palude Tetra, nota per avere così tante sorgenti di acqua termale da rendere il clima più mite. Da queste sorgenti sgorga acqua sulfurea, che puzza parecchio, ma molti avventurieri la preferiscono al congelamento. Per questo motivo, state viaggiando verso South Pim. il secondo più grande insediamento della Grande Palude Tetra dopo Lake Gloomy, un luogo noto come un buon di partenza per gli avventureieri.

Chissà quali avventure vi attendono nella Grande Palude Tetra!

boardgame.name: Judge Dredd: I am the Law – Starter Set
boardgame.description:
Judge Dredd is a skirmish tabletop miniatures game for two or more players set in the Judge Dredd universe created by legendary comic creators John Wagner and Carlos Ezquerra.
In it, Street Judges patrol the towering City Blocks and crammed streets of the vast megalopolis Mega-City One, a city full of criminals, gangs, crazies, and murderers.
Only the uncompromising resolve of the Judges stands in the way to total lawlessness.

In Judge Dredd, players take control of a small team of Judges or Perps as they fight for justice or survival in the mean streets of Mega-City One and beyond.

The Judge Dredd rulebook contains everything you need to know about playing the game and includes rules for fighting within buildings and using vehicles. As well as a number of scenarios, there are rules for developing your chosen faction in a series of linked games.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Taxi! Board Game: London
boardgame.description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Taxi Board Game (Taxi Game Ltd)

boardgame.name: Judge Dredd: Judge Dredd
boardgame.description:
For millions of Mega-City One’s citizens there can be no greater symbol of the law than Judge Joe Dredd, not even the Statue of Judgement itself. The mere mention of his name is enough to give even the most hardened criminals pause.

Dredd has been appointed a temporary member of the Council of Five on several occasions. However, he is only truly content when patrolling the streets dispensing the law directly and his well-known dislike of bureaucracy keeps him well away from the Hall of Justice.

If it is true that a man can be measured by the quality of his enemies then Dredd will take some beating. Over the years, he has clashed with mad Chief Judges, transdimensional denizens of Deadworld, super agents of the Sov Bloc, necromancers and powerful mutant pre-cogs. Yet it’s probably safe to say that from Dredd’s perspective bringing one of these individuals to justice is no more important than the prosecution of a citizen for littering or a juve for spraying graffiti on a wall. Everyone is equal in the eyes of the law!

—description from the publisher
